intro: Amaranthus mangostanus var. parvifolius, commonly known as the dwarf mangosteen, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically covered in a thin, waxy layer. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in lowland areas with well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some regions for both aesthetic and practical purposes.
